posts.post_content:
I don't get what the designers were thinking, "Hey lets make a birds like creatures but for only one shard",   
"sounds cool, I think bant would fit best"   
"but it needs something to fit the shard's theme, Exalted would work well"   
"Yeah! and because it's a mana fixer we could make her a 0/1 so she can't be used for offence like Llanowar Elves, there, perfectly balanced"  
"oh wait..."  
Yeah I don't get it.  
  
Try havaing to face a second one on turn 2 and be hit my a 2/3 birds of bant, very annoying.

posts.post_content: She indeed is better than Birds in a right deck. It's also great how you don't really need to be playing a deck centered around exalted to make the most of her abilities. You don't even have to be playing aggro strategy. I use her in a mana ramp/control build and she makes everything work so much better. Power, speed, versatility - Noble Hierarch has it all. 5/5

Posted By: True_Mumin (10/29/2009 4:57:45 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Nah it's 42 I think. Because there's 2 combat phases, if attacks alone twice, it will get twice as many exalted bonuses. For the first combat phase 3/3+5 exalted makes for an 8/8 double strike (16 damage), and in the second combat phase an 8/8 double strike+5 more exalted means 13/13 double strike (26 damage), which totals for 42 damage.
posts.html:

posts.post_content: understanding that MTG creates cards to be played within their block, This is literally the most key card a Bant deck could want. In a bant deck everything must be exalted, plus she taps for mana! On the first turn no less!!! this means you're playing a giltspire avenger second turn, rafiq of the many third turn, and a battlegrace angel the fourth. if you cannot win with that combination then you should be ashamed...

Posted By: VirtueVsVice (11/7/2009 2:57:40 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: For years, one could argue using [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves) over [Birds of Paradise](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Birds of Paradise) because having 1 power was a valuable thing. [Noble Hierarch](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Noble Hierarch) has ended that debate. It can still ping early like the Elves, it gets you enough colors to be a functional Birds, and unlike either, it is never a dead draw late-game. The only thing Birds still have going for them is that they can fly in carrying a sword. The role of [Llanowar Elves](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Llanowar Elves) has been reduced to tribal decks :(
posts.html:
For years, one could argue using Llanowar Elves over Birds of Paradise because having 1 power was a valuable thing. Noble Hierarch has ended that debate. It can still ping early like the Elves, it gets you enough colors to be a functional Birds, and unlike either, it is never a dead draw late-game. The only thing Birds still have going for them is that they can fly in carrying a sword. The role of Llanowar Elves has been reduced to tribal decks :(

posts.post_content:
Not only can she attack for the same amount as Llanowar Elves, but she also contributes to your attack even if she's not the one attacking (like, if you're using her for mana, as you almost always will).  
  
My only complaint is that she can't go into an EDH deck if you're only running two of her three colors.
